arts.ttl: Mallorca win the battle of the holiday islands
arts.sum: Real Mallorca ended a run of six games in all competitions without a win, as they romped to a 3-1 victory over a poor Las Palmas side in front of 18,475 fans on Sunday night. Into the second half and the Palma side looked to put the game to bed, but Rodriguez blasted over and Muriqi hit the base of the post.

arts.ttl: Las Palmas star to miss Barcelona clash
arts.sum: La Liga strugglers Las Palmas are set to be without a leading member of the club’s backline for their next outing. This comes owing to developments in Los Amarillos’ latest…

Mallorca are on a tricky run of form, failing to win in their previous four games. In their previous five, Mallorca have scored just twice, fewer than any other La Liga side during the same time frame...

arts.ttl: Ten-man Ipswich showed 'fight' in draw at Villa - McKenna
arts.sum: Boss Kieran McKenna says his team are "fighting until the last breath" as 10-man Ipswich hold on to draw 1-1 at Aston Villa.

arts.ttl: 10-man Ipswich showed 'fight' in draw at Villa - McKenna
arts.sum: Kieran McKenna says his team are "fighting until the last breath" as 10-man Ipswich hold on to draw 1-1 away at Aston Villa.

arts.ttl: A brilliant day – Ipswich boss Kieran McKenna lauds debutant keeper Alex Palmer
arts.sum: The 28-year-old helped his side hold on for a point at Aston Villa.

arts.ttl: Saint-Étienne predicted XI v Marseille: Irvin Cardona starts, Augustine Boakye dropped
arts.sum: Eirik Horneland’s AS Saint-Étienne are searching for their first victory in five as they travel to the Stade Vélodrome to face an in-form Olympique de Marseille. Recent results have seen…
